channel.title: For, Do, and While
channel.description:
I've always prefered while because it's what I learned in my first programming language and sadly that's all it had.
From what I can gather For and Do seem to do a similar task, is there any benefit to using one or the other or is there actually a huge difference that I'm missing. BTW started c++ 2 nights ago, sorry lol.
I've also noticed that For seems to declare a variable inside of it's parameters, maybe I'll go google it alittle more.

item.title: For, Do, and While
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

All of them have a use, it looks like quarter’s post is the most comprehensive to tell you what you need to know.

Read full topic

item.title: For, Do, and While
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

a do loop is different then a for/while loop, cause it guarantees you at least one run.

do
{
    //Code here will be executed once
}while(false);

while(false)
{
   //While this won't
}

and a for loop should be used, when your while loop would look like:

int i = 0;
while(i < someValue)
{
    //Some code

    i++;
}

//Similar for loop
for(int i = 0; i < someValue; i++)
{
   //code
}

Damn frank_ you beaten me while typing.

Read full topic

item.title: For, Do, and While
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

while is the same as for with no initialisation or increment statement, ie for (; cond;)

do tests the condition at the end of the loop body so is useful where it must be executed at least once

Read full topic
